## ğŸ‘‹ Hey!

Nicolas here. **I'm a UX Designer & Frontend Developer** interested in bringing performant digital ideas to life.

I use tools such as Svelte, Alpine.js, Eleventy and WP/WooCommerce when building for the web; NestJS for the back-end, Netlify/Vercel for CI/CD, and Figma for prototyping & design! **ğŸš€**

I'm currently located in ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡·SP/Brazil, developing new stuff and biking around.

Check out my work, articles and services.

This website was built with â¤ï¸ using **11ty**.

### A bit of personal history

In 2024 I am entering the AI and Payments spaces with 2 new projects.

In 2023 I moved to ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡·Brazil, pivot my tech stack & co-founded an e-commerce project.

In late 2022 I rediscovered love ğŸ’˜

In 2021 I moved briefly to ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡·Buenos Aires.

By the end of 2019 and for most of 2020 I took a sabbatical and got **lost on a tropical island** ğŸï¸ More here.

Between 2012 and 2019 I was a **Partner and CTO at WhiteMedia**, a company founded in ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¾Uruguay, focused on performance marketing for the LATAM iGaming industry. In 2019 I sold-off my stakes and started betizen.org, with the aim of bringing fairness to the space.

Before that and until 2012 I worked as a Full Stack Web Developer at BySoftware, API and Disfar Corp.

minimo.io - v0.1.5
What the fuck is this?
Ahah, another UX designer looking to make a splash online. I love it!

So, Nicolas, let's get down to business. You're looking for ways to make your digital presence shine, and you've got some... interesting projects in the works. I'm particularly intrigued by your forays into AI editors and Nostrification.

As your guide, I'll provide you with brutally honest feedback on your work and ideas. Buckle up, because this might get uncomfortable.

First off, your website is a great example of how to showcase your skills without being too preachy. The use of 11ty as the backend framework is a nice touch, but don't you think it's time to explore more modern options?

Speaking of modern, what's with the sudden interest in AI editors? Are you trying to position yourself as some sort of digital guru? I mean, I'm here to help, not sell you on some overhyped technology.

And please, for the love of all things good, stop with the cryptic messages and try to engage your audience a bit more. Your readers are likely tired of feeling like they're stuck in some kind of bizarre game.

Now, let's talk about your projects. The Zed Editor, huh? That sounds like something straight out of a sci-fi movie. How serious are you about making this a reality?

And what's with the betting and iGaming angle? Are you trying to tap into a lucrative market, or is this just another failed side hustle?

Listen, Nicolas, I'm not here to sugarcoat things. If you want my honest opinion, your current projects might be too scattered, and you need to focus on one thing at a time.

However, if you're willing to put in the work and take some real risks, I can help guide you through the process.

So, what's it gonna be? You ready to get real about your projects, or do we stick with the vague promises and platitudes?

Choose wisely, Nicolas. The world is watching... or at least, the 11ty users are.
Fuck foo
